findings.title: Desktop application configuration file stored in group writable file
findings.description: The desktop application configuration file has group writable permissions, allowing anyone to modify it and control the address that receives farming rewards.

findings.title: Insufficient validation of users’ reward addresses
findings.description: The code that imports users’ reward addresses does not sufficiently validate them.

findings.title: Improper error handling
findings.description: The functions Config::init, Config::write, removePlot, and createPlotDir do not show users an error message if they fail to perform their operations, leading to unclear sources of failure.

findings.title: Flawed regex in the Tauri configuration
findings.description: The Tauri configuration uses a flawed regex `[/subspace\\-desktop/]` which matches any string with a single character inside the square brackets, instead of matching file names that include the `/subspace-desktop/` string.

findings.title: Insufficient privilege separation between the front end and back end
findings.description: The front end has excessive permissions allowing it to execute shell commands and access sensitive features, which can lead to arbitrary code execution and other security issues.

findings.title: Vulnerable dependencies
findings.description: Some Node and Rust dependencies are vulnerable to high- and moderate-severity issues.

findings.title: Broken error reporting link
findings.description: The URL for a Discord invitation in the `sp_panic_handler::set()` function is broken, preventing users from submitting bug reports.

findings.title: Side effects are triggered regardless of disk_farms validity
findings.description: The `farm` function checks the `disk_farms` arguments, which originate from the front end. The `farm` function’s checks are spread across the code and are interleaved with code that triggers side effects that do not influence the subsequent checks of `disk_farms`. This means that certain side effects could be triggered even if one of the checks determines that a given `disk_ farms` argument is invalid.

findings.title: Network configuration path construction is duplicated
findings.description: The `create_full_client` function contains code that uses hard-coded strings to indicate configuration paths instead of previously defined constants, which is a risky coding pattern.
